results.title: Barefoot
results.creator_credit: C B Wismar, Melvin Hersh, Stan Hersh and Concordia Films
results.brief_description: Worn down on his luck, a frustrated salesman makes his rounds in the noise of the city. He is suddenly surrounded by children who turn his day inside out leaving him free of inhibitions and anger and appreciating life more.
results.creator_credit_for_label: C B Wismar, Melvin Hersh, Stan Hersh and Concordia Films

results.title: Bamboo: plant of a thousand uses
results.creator_credit: Robert Lang, Sterling S Beath and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: Although this is a film about the traditional and everyday uses of bamboo, it also portrays many aspects of contemporary living in Japan; life in urban centres and rural areas and aspects of agriculture, handicrafts, art and types of shelter are explored. This giant grass is noted for its beauty and commercial value and it provides a livelihood for many Japanese families.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lang, Sterling S Beath and Bailey Film Productions

results.title: Back into the sun
results.creator_credit: Fergus McDonell, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the hospital of the Allen Memorial Institute in Montreal helps patients back to mental and emotional health. The case presented is of a woman who is under severe emotional distress. Interviews with a psychiatrist and group therapy sessions show her the root of her trouble, and set her on the right path to overcoming her problem.

results.title: Baby story
results.creator_credit: Bruno Bozzetto and Bruno Bozzetto Films
results.brief_description: Bozzetto’s animated comic version of life in the womb. Illustrates the struggle of the sperm to fertilise the ovum when opposed by contraceptives.

results.title: Away from it all
results.creator_credit: Jean Roy, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Terra Nova Park, Newfoundland, is the most recent example of the purpose and dimension of Canada’s national parks system - a plan which sets aside, for the enjoyment of present and future generations, scenic acres of wilderness, undisturbed except for roads, camp-sites, and other amenities. This film shows how Terra Nova was developed and how it offers a restful escape from the clamor of the city. Award: Annual Film Festival, Columbus, Ohio.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Roy, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.description: Terra Nova Park, Newfoundland, is the most recent example of the purpose and dimension of Canada’s national parks system - a plan which sets aside, for the enjoyment of present and future generations, scenic acres of wilderness, undisturbed except for roads, camp-sites, and other amenities. results.title: An Award for Mr. Rossi
results.brief_description: A satiric cartoon on the experimental film and its audience. Mr. Rossi buys a cine camera and sets out to make an oscar-winning film using his wife as the star. No other credits available.

results.title: Avocets return
results.creator_credit: Anthony Clay, Anthony Bomford and RSPB Film and Video Unit
results.brief_description: This film shows how the Avocet has returned to Britain, as a breeding bird, after a lapse of 100 years. Filmed in Suffolk and Cornwall, it traces the natural history of the Avocet, and the success of the Royal Society for the Protection of Birds in protecting rare species.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anthony Clay, Anthony Bomford and RSPB Film and Video Unit

results.title: Automatic process control
results.brief_description: Illustrates the advantages to be derived from applying automatic control to a process in a small chemical plant. The four modes of control are discussed: on/off; proportional; proportional with reset; proportional with reset and rate action. An application of instrumentation for continuous process control is explained.
results.description: Illustrates the advantages to be derived from applying automatic control to a process in a small chemical plant. The four modes of control are discussed: on/off; proportional; proportional with reset; proportional with reset and rate action. An application of instrumentation for continuous process control is explained.

results.title: Conversion to automatic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
Demonstrates how the automatic transmission operates and discusses the routine procedures the driver should follow for the safe driving of an automatic vehicle.
